Package space.sunqian.common.cache

Interface SimpleCache<K,V>

Type Parameters:
K - the key type
V - the value type
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractSimpleCache
@ThreadSafe public interface SimpleCache<K,V>
This interface is a simplified key-value pair cache interface (implementations must be thread-safe). It only provides get, put, remove and clean operations, and supports null value but does not allow null key. It is suitable for scenarios that require simple cache operations and do not care about the cache lifecycle.

It is recommended to use the skeletal implementation: AbstractSimpleCache.

See Also:
  • AbstractSimpleCache

  • Method Details

    • ofWeak

      @Nonnull static <K, V> @Nonnull SimpleCache<K,V> ofWeak()
      Returns a new SimpleCache based on WeakReference. The values of the returned cache will be automatically collected by the garbage collection based on the characteristics of WeakReference. Its clean() method releases all entries of which values are collected, and this method is automatically invoked once every time another method is executed.
      Type Parameters:
      K - the key type
      V - the value type
      Returns:
      a new SimpleCache based on WeakReference

    • ofSoft

      @Nonnull static <K, V> @Nonnull SimpleCache<K,V> ofSoft()
      Returns a new SimpleCache based on SoftReference. The values of the returned cache will be automatically collected by the garbage collection based on the characteristics of SoftReference. Its clean() method releases all entries of which values are collected, and this method is automatically invoked once every time another method is executed.
      Type Parameters:
      K - the key type
      V - the value type
      Returns:
      a new SimpleCache based on SoftReference

    • ofPhantom

      @Nonnull static <K, V> @Nonnull SimpleCache<K,V> ofPhantom()
      Returns a new SimpleCache based on PhantomReference. The values of the returned cache will be automatically collected by the garbage collection based on the characteristics of PhantomReference. Its clean() method releases all entries of which values are collected, and this method is automatically invoked once every time another method is executed.
      Type Parameters:
      K - the key type
      V - the value type
      Returns:
      a new SimpleCache based on PhantomReference

    • ofStrong

      @Nonnull static <K, V> @Nonnull SimpleCache<K,V> ofStrong()
      Returns a new SimpleCache based on strong reference. The values of the returned cache will never automatically be invalid, and its clean() method does nothing. The behavior of the returned cache is just like a regular Map.
      Type Parameters:
      K - the key type
      V - the value type
      Returns:
      a new SimpleCache based on strong reference

    • get

      @Nullable V get(@Nonnull K key)
      Returns the value for the specified key, or null if the value is invalid or is null itself. Use getVal(Object) to distinguish between these cases.
      Parameters:
      key - the specified key
      Returns:
      the value for the specified key, or null if the value is invalid or is null itself

    • getVal

      @Nullable @Nullable Val<@Nullable V> getVal(@Nonnull K key)

      Parameters:
      key - the specified key
      Returns:
      the value wrapped by Val for the specified key, or null if the value is invalid

    • get

      V get(@Nonnull K key, @Nonnull @Nonnull Function<? super @Nonnull K,? extends @Nullable V> producer)
      Returns the value for the specified key. If the value is invalid, the producer will be called to generate a new value, and the new value will be cached and returned. If an exception is thrown during the generation, the exception will be thrown directly. This operation is atomic.

      Any value, including null, generated by the producer will be cached. To distinguish between null value or no-cached, try getVal(Object, Function).

      Parameters:
      key - the specified key
      producer - the producer to generate new value
      Returns:
      the value for the specified key, including null

    • getVal

      @Nullable @Nullable Val<@Nullable V> getVal(@Nonnull K key, @Nonnull @Nonnull Function<? super @Nonnull K,? extends @Nullable Val<? extends @Nullable V>> producer)
      Returns the value wrapped by Val for the specified key. If the value is invalid, the producer will be called to generate a new value wrapped by Val, and the new value will be cached and returned. If an exception is thrown during the generation, the exception will be thrown directly. This operation is atomic.

      If the producer generates a null, no value will be cached, and this method will return null.

      Parameters:
      key - the specified key
      producer - the producer to generate new value wrapped by Val
      Returns:
      the value wrapped by Val for the specified key, or null if the producer generates a null
